Context:
Program Name: Marketing Management – Digital Media
Code: B423
Credential: Ontario College Graduate Certificate
Method of Study: Full-time
Duration: 12 months (2 semesters in-class, 1 semester work experience)
Starting Months: January, September
Domestic Tuition: $4,618.00 *
Centre: Business
School: Marketing
Location: Online
Experiential Learning: Work Experience (Co-op or Internship) Required.
Program Description: The Marketing Management – Digital Media (Online) graduate certificate program covers social media marketing, mobile marketing, search marketing, content marketing, owned media marketing, paid media marketing, and marketing analytics. Students will enjoy working on a capstone project during their final semester.

* This tuition fee is for domestic students only. International student fees may vary.

Context: This Marketing Management – Digital Media (Online) program offered by George Brown's School of Marketing is designed to prepare graduates for careers in marketing communications and planning, client services, and media planning and buying. The skills acquired include recommending digital communication strategies, conducting market research, evaluating product viability, delivering persuasive messages, and preparing sales pitches or presentations. The program is offered online and requires a computer with Windows 10 or Mac OSX, high-speed broadband access, headphones/speaker with microphone, and webcam for in-class conversations. Students need to complete a one-semester work experience term after the second academic semester, which can be co-op (paid) or internship (unpaid). George Brown facilitates identifying potential work experience opportunities, and students are encouraged to pursue self-directed industry work experiences as well. Technical requirements also include a web browser such as Safari, Firefox, MS Edge, Google Chrome. Mobile devices may allow for some participation in the course but cannot guarantee meeting all needs.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2024/Marketing Management – Digital Media Program (Online) (Postgraduate) B423 | George Brown College2024.txt

Context:
Students are encouraged to seek self-directed industry work experience opportunities and can add this valuable experience to their resumé. George Brown College offers field education opportunities with real-world challenges and clients through the Centre for Business. Marketing students have access to membership in two Canadian marketing associations, the CMA and IAB, included in their tuition fees.

CMA membership benefits include live and online events, professional development opportunities, tools, resources, and guides, networking opportunities, and exclusive access to CMA NXT. IAB membership benefits include student volunteer opportunities for marquee events, members-only webinars and podcasts, original Canadian digital marketing research, globally accepted digital ad standards, standardized courses, certification, and custom workshops.

Graduates from the Digital Media Marketing program will be prepared for careers in various roles such as Digital Marketing Assistant/Manager, Social Media Coordinator/Manager, Digital Content Manager, Media Planner, Digital Analyst, Community Manager, SEM Specialist, SEO Analyst, Account Coordinator/Manager. In-demand skills developed in the program include digital marketing, SEO, Google Analytics, and Microsoft 365. The college helps students obtain various marketing certifications such as Hootsuite Social Marketing certification, Hootsuite Platform certification, Google Analytics certification, Google Ads certification, and Facebook Blueprint certification. (Certifications are awarded by the certifying body and not George Brown College.)

Career options for graduates may include Digital Marketing Assistant/Manager, Social Media Coordinator/Manager, Digital Content Manager, Media Planner, Digital Analyst, Community Manager, SEM Specialist, SEO Analyst, Account Coordinator/Manager. The college is aligned with in-demand skills suggested by Randstad, including digital marketing, SEO, Google Analytics, and Microsoft 365.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2024/Marketing Management – Digital Media Program (Online) (Postgraduate) B423 | George Brown College2024.txt

Context:
The George Brown College offers a B423 program which is delivered online for domestic students only. This program requires a total of 13 mandatory courses and 1 work experience semester to graduate. The work experience term can be in the form of co-op, internship, simulation, consulting, or research projects.

The following are the courses offered in Semester 1:
- BUS 4000: Work Experience Prep Course (none)
- MARK 1044: Search Marketing (none)
- MARK 2037: Database Marketing Strategies (none)
- MARK 4005: Applied Business Communication (none)
- MARK 4019: Fundamentals of Marketing And IMC (none)
- MARK 4022: Content Marketing (none)
- MARK 4023: Paid Media Marketing (none)

The following are the courses offered in Semester 2:
- MARK 1051: Social Media Marketing (MARK 4022 prerequisite)
- STRATEGIC MARKETING PROJECT (Successful completion of semester 1)
- MARK 4020: Owned Media Marketing (MARK 1044 and MARK 4019)
- MARK 1054: Analytics for Digital Marketing (MARK 4019 prerequisite)
- MARK 4019: Introduction to OMNI Channel Marketing (MARK 4019)
- MARK 4024: Digital Media Marketing Seminar Series (none)

The work experience term is COOP 4005 / INTN 4005 / BAWT 4005 with a prerequisite of BUS 4000.

The graduates of the program are expected to be able to:
1. Formulate a marketing plan that will meet the needs or goals of a business or organization.
2. Develop an integrated marketing communications plan for a product, concept, good and/or service based on an identified market need or target.
3. Formulate strategies for developing new and/or modified products, concepts, goods and services that respond to evolving market needs.
4. Develop strategies for the efficient and effective placement/distribution of products, concepts, goods and services that respond to evolving markets.
5. Evaluate the impact of using different marketing strategies for a product, concept, good and/or service on finances, Return on Investment (ROI).

Context:
To apply for admission to George Brown College, domestic students should apply through Ontario Colleges. English proficiency requirements and exemptions information can be found on the college's website. Information sessions are held regularly for interested applicants. For inquiries about domestic admission requirements, deadlines, or the admissions process, contact the Admissions Office at [admissions@georgebrown.ca](mailto:admissions@georgebrown.ca) or visit the Admissions section. International students should contact international recruitment representatives specializing by country of origin for information and booking a virtual meeting or submitting an inquiry. For financial aid, OSAP, bursaries, scholarships, and other related inquiries, please contact the Financial Aid Office at [FinAid@georgebrown.ca](mailto:FinAid@georgebrown.ca) or visit the Financial Aid section. To receive advice on program options and which program might be best suited, make an appointment to see an Entry Advisor. For inquiries related to specific programs, contact the respective program coordinator. Contact the Centre for Business at [business@georgebrown.ca](mailto:business@georgebrown.ca) or (416) 415-5000 ext. 2160 for questions or information regarding programs and services offered.
